turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: We send the gold up what's to stop him from taking off and leaving us down here?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: He's not going to leave us.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What's to stop him if he wanted to?  All he has to do is cut the line...

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Why do I have to stay down here?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Jesus, Jaeger.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I don't see how that plan's any better.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Someone's got to send the gold up.  It can't get on the line by itself.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: All right.  You go up, I'll send up the gold, then follow.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah.  Yeah, that'll work.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What the hell took so long.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Just had to get the pack unhooked from the line.  It didn't seem that long.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Not when you're up here with the gold, I guess not.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Wes might be right about that.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It stays as it is.  We're halfway home now.  Let's not blow it by people getting ideas.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We should head Northeast.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Northeast?  That's away from the Hummer; further into Iraqi.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: There's another pass on the photo.  We can avoid that narrow one we had to cross on the way up, and it should get us back down.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: It should, or it will?  Least going back the way we came we know what we're up against.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You think you can make that pass weighted down when you almost fell the first time you're wrong, and you're not going to take my share of the gold with you trying it.  We're heading Northeast.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What are we going to do?  How are we going to find our way back!?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We'll find our way.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: How!?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We'll find our way!  We'll...

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We got to go back.  We got to go back for Wes.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Forget Wes.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We can't just leave him.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Wes is dead!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What if he's not?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Then he will be when those Iraqis get to him.  He was going to kill you.  He was one blink away from it.  He's dead, Epps, and I'm sure as hell not getting my head blow off over his carcass.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We need something:  A flare, a signal mirror.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What do you mean no?  They can fly us home.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: They'll ask questions; want to know why we were out here.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We'll lie.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: They'll search the pack.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: First Wes, now you?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I'm not like Wes.  Wes was crazy.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: And you; you've got it all together.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I don't want it this way.  I wouldn't kill you just to kill you, but I can't let you lose the gold for me.  Not when we're so close.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: That helicopter passes, and the only thing we're close to is death.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I'm sorry about that, Epps.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Is it all right if I stand up?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I'm glad I didn't have to kill you.  I'm glad it didn't come to that.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Yeah.  Well, me too.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I never killed anybody before.  I talk a good game, but I'm not like that.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Really, I'm not.  Remember how I was talking I wanted to blow away all those Iraqis?  That's all it was was talk.  I was scared out of my mind to go to war. I still haven't gotten over stepping on that land mine.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You still got a map on you?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What?  Yeah.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Epps?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I don't want to die.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Makes two of us.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I know what I did just now was crazy, but you got to understand how much I want that gold.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's all right.  I don't like it, but it's over now.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I never had anything before, Epps.  I never was anybody.  Not the kind of somebody you can be with a pocket full of gold coins.  When I was in high school I used to--

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Damn.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What do you think our chances are?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: If we can find the Hummer, or some friendlies by sundown we might be okay. We've got enough water for that.  But we won't make another day otherwise.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Wonder how the war's going?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's got to be going better than this..

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We can't just sit here.  We've got to start moving, so pick.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You sure you want me too?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I pick that way.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Okay.  Then we go this way.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Getting cold.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's a desert.  That's what deserts do at night; they get cold.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Epps...Epps!  I'm gonna stop for a second.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Just let me rest for a second.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We've got to keep moving while there's still light.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You know what I'm going to do?  I'm just going to take a second.  I want to look at the gold.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Don't you touch it.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I just want to look at it.  Remind me of what I'm dying for.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: The deal was no one touches it until we get out of here.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah, but we made that deal while Wes was still alive.  He's gone.  Time for a new deal.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What do you figure it is?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Place all alone like that?  Must be a boarder check point.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Which boarder?  Saudi?  Kuwait?  Syria?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Couldn't be Syria.  We couldn't have gone that far north.  It's got to be Saudi. Come on.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We can head back for our lines, and they don't even have to know about the gold.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Epps.  What if they're not Saudi.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Well, we should identify ourselves.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah, I guess we should.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Even if they are Iraqis probably all they'll do is take us prisoner for awhile.  Got to figure we're still kicking their asses in the war.  They don't want any trouble.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Hell, they'll probably just surrender to us.  Probably.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: That's if the war is even still going on. Way things were shaping up it's probably long over.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Probably.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I don't know.  Something Wes had taught me.  I think it means "Don't shoot. We're your friends."

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: They must be Saudis.  It's a Saudi checkpoint.  Oh sweet, Jesus.  Come on. Come on!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Oh, God...

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: They must have thought we were Iraqi when you yelled to them.  They couldn't tell in the dark.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What are we going to do?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Slip out your M-16.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: And then what?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: And then shoot them.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I...I never killed anyone before.  I told you that.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Well, you're going to start with a bang, 'cause you've got four of them to take down.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Can't you--

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I don't have a weapon.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Don't go bitch on me now!  You were going to kill me.  Kill them!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I just said I would.  I don't think I--

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Shoot them!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: An Iraqi?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I don't know.  He didn't have a uniform on.  He...he had on white robes, like the guys who killed Wes.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What do we do?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We can't stay here.  Even if that wasn't an Iraqi soldier it's only a matter of time before some show up.  Get all the water you can carry, and we'll head out on foot.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: To where?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Sun rises in the East.  We go the opposite direction.  May not find anything, but at least we'll know we're heading towards Saudi Arabia.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What do we do?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We keep going, that's what we do.  We ignore them, maybe they ignore us.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What do you make of them?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Shi'ites, I think.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Is that good, or bad?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I don't know.  They killed Wes.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Why haven't they killed us!?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I don't know!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: ...Maybe...maybe we can fight our way out.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: With what?  Against how many?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: We can't just sit here waiting to die.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You come up with a better plan, let me know.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Maybe...maybe if we traded them the gold. If we gave it to them they might let us live; they might not kill us.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You were shot.  We were standing right there, you were shot!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I didn't say that.  I never said--

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Me?  I say you don't have enough brains to be stupid.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Can you ride a horse?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: No, but I figure now's a real good time to start.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Which way do we go!?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We go this way.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Damn it.  We lost the horses.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: The...the gold...

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It wasn't the gold.  It was the claymore mine.  The gold's in my pack.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: When did you make the switch?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's always been like that.  When you left me down in the crevice to send the gold up I figured I'd better...take precautions.  I rigged it to blow if anyone opened the pack.  Just in case somebody thought they could do better on their own.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We had a deal.  No one touches the gold until we're out of here.  No one breaks the deal, no one had anything to worry about.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What if it hadn't been Wes?  What if...I mean, accidently, what if I had...

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You shouldn't think about things like that.  It'll just make you crazy.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: A car's got to come along sooner or later.  When it does, we jack it.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: How do we do that?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You lie in the middle of the road, look like you're hurt.  When the car stops I run over to the driver and put a gun to his head.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Why do I have to lie in the road?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Somebody has to.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah, but why me?  What if the car doesn't stop?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Then I'm a rich man.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Epps.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I want you to know... I don't know.  I just think you're a hell of a guy.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: This whole time, you've kept your head. You didn't go money simple like me and Wes.  You've just been trying to figure how to get us out of here.  And you've been fair too.  I mean, even after I...you know...

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Threatened to blow my brains out?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah.  Even after that.  You didn't take it out on me, except for maybe making me lie in the middle of the road now.  But I'd say you've been very fair.  I just think it's a hell of a man who can keep from going money simple.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Don't make so much out of it.  Only reason I haven't figured a way to get all that money for myself is because I've been too busy figuring ways to stay alive.  Believe me; if I had a minute to catch my breath I might have played things the way you and Wes had.  I'm no better than anybody else.  I've just been busier.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Epps?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I'm thinking about taking a trip.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Thought you were going to buy a car.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Still am.  There's more gold than I thought, and since there's only two of us now...  Where should I go?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I've never been anywhere.  I wouldn't know where to go.  Where would you go?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: How the hell should I know?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Australia.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I'd go to Australia.  Lot of land, not many people.  I think after this I'd like to quit people for awhile.  And the girls go crazy for brothers down there.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: That's what I hear.  Don't matter.  Girls go crazy everywhere for a man with gold.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Well, this is it.  We get the car, find some Americans.  We find Americans we'll be all right.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We'll make up some kind of lie.  They won't find the gold.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Epps, I don't think he's slowing down.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: He'll slow down.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: He's not slowing.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: He's going to slow down.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Woods.

turns.speaker: WOODS
turns.text: Hey, Jaeger.  What's up.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I'm looking for a favor.  I need a map of Iraqi.

turns.speaker: WOODS
turns.text: A map?  All I got is maps.  I'm gonna have Delayed Map Syndrome when I finally get out of here.  What kind of map you need?  Topographical, geographical, thermal?

turns.speaker: WOODS
turns.text: That shouldn't be too hard to read.  Iraq is the pink thing.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I could use some recon photos too.

turns.speaker: WOODS
turns.text: Planning on going to war all by your lonesome?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Just...want to be ready when we do.

turns.speaker: WOODS
turns.text: Ready for what?  Sight-seeing?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: The photos.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Some good ones.

turns.speaker: WOODS
turns.text: They're all good ones.  Satellites we've got can snap a shot of the boil on Saddam's ass.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Saddam's got a boil on his ass?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Could you stop, please.  You're giving me a headache.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: A headache?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Yeah, a headache.  My head hurts.  You're making me uncomfortable.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I'm making you uncomfortable.  Baking away in a desert in the middle of nowhere facing three-hundred-thousand screaming Iraqis with nerve gas scud missiles, that doesn't bother you.  But me making a little noise is driving you out of your skull.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Yes.  Yes.  That's exactly it.  Yes.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: We ought to kick their asses anyway. Even if they do get out of Kuwait we ought to kick their asses.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I don't think we'll go to war.  We shouldn't even be here.  This isn't our fight, it's a regional conflict.  It should be decided regionally.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: People are suffering.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: People were suffering in Afganistan, and we didn't do anything.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: When do you ever point the soles of your feet at people?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I'm saying don't do it accidently.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Oh yeah.  Accidently.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Come on.  You're going to get us in trouble.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: It was an accident.  You saw it was an accident.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I'm just trying to help you guys out.  It doesn't hurt to know something about Saudi Arabia.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Spanish wasn't hard enough?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I thought it would be good to know.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Don't shoot me, I'm friendly.  You can use that when you surrender.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: How do you say "Come here, baby.  I'm horny."  I can use that now.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Don't even try it.  You offend a woman out here you're in serious trouble.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Now you need me.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What is it?  You know so much about Arabland tell me what it is.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: He says it's a box.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah, you're funny.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: It's a puzzle box.  If you can figure out how to open it there's supposed to be a treasure inside.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: For real?  A treasure?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: And you're the guy who's going to open it.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I could.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You get it yet?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Naw, nothing.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You will.  You'll get it.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I'll show Epps.  He'll be sorry when I get this thing open.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You really think there's a treasure inside?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I don't care if there's a lump of coal in here.  I just want to be able to rub Epps' face in it when I crack this thing.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Jaeger?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You know the fifteenth is the deadline for the Iraqis to get out of Kuwait.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah.  So?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: That's in two days.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Like I said; so?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: They're cancelling all leaves, all passes.  No more drills.  We stand at full ready starting--

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What's your point, Wes?  You have a point?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: We're going to war, aren't we.  If they're doing all that it must mean we're going to war.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: It doesn't mean anything.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Why would they do all that if we weren't?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Jaeger?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What!?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You ever think about dying?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Come on, man.  I almost had this thing open.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You ever think about it?  You ever worry?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: The only thing I worry about is how much Iraqi ass I'm going to be able to kick before this whole thing is over.  The only people who I've got anything to worry about are the poor, dumb camel jockeys who don't know enough to get out of the way when I come rolling at them; an M-16 in each hand, and a grenade between my teeth.  Now if you'll excuse me, soldier, I'd like to get back to my box.  I've got a treasure to find.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: At-at-at-at-at.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: This is so weird.  It's happening, but it's not.  It's like a TV show, and we're part of it.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: At-at-at-at-at.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: The longer the air force hits the Iraqis, the safer it'II be for us when we have to engage.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You know what, Wes?  If you get a note from your mommy they might excuse you from the war.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: It's...it's...I don't know what it is.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: It's a container.  Break the seal.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: That's it.  It's over.  Eighteen hours into the war and it's over.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Those soldiers have got loafers on.  What kind of army gives their soldiers loafers?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: We...we could go home with something else.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: With...with millions.  Millions of dollars.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You're not saying what I think you're saying.  I can't believe you're even thinking it.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: It's right here.  This region; an-Nagaf. I got recon photos.  There're no troops there, no fighting--

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You don't know where the Iraqis have moved to.  And our forces haven't even engaged the Republican Guard yet, we don't know--

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: It's about a hundred miles from where we are now.  How long do you think it would take us to--

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: It's not a hundred miles.  It's a hundred miles through three different kinds of terrain:  Pure desert, mountains, a river.  If the map is even real.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: It's real.  I'm telling you, it's real.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: So you just want to cross into hostile territory in the middle of a war on a wild goose chase?  It's crazy.  Tell him it's crazy, Epps.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Epps, you're smarter than this.  Jaeger I understand, but you're smarter.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You know it's real.  You know it's real, and you know it's there.  You know it.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You're insane if you think you'll find anything, and sure insane if you think you can get us there and back alive.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: God!  I don't believe I'm doing this.  I don't.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: We're going to get court martialed, you know that.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Hell, we'll just buy our way out.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Epps, is that a sand dune.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Oh, no.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Hey, Wes, what kind of treasure you figure these people buried?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: If!  If there's a treasure.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah.  If.  Whatever.  What kind you figure it is?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I don't know.  It would be small, easy to transport and hide.  Gold or jewels. Probably gold.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah!  Gold!  How much?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: How the hell should I know how much?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: If there's gold.  If!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You know what I'm doing with my half?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: This is too much.  You don't even have the money and you're wasting it.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: A car is not just a car where I come from.  I had this friend, had this wicked candy apple red Sixty-four and a half Mustang--

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Iraqis.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Oh, God!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Two vehicles.  They're not supposed to be here.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Oh, Jesus!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: They're not...I had the pictures. They're not supposed to be here!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah!  Yeah!

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I think I'm going to throw up.  I am. I'm going to toss.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You see that?  Right by us.  They went right by.  You had them Epps; you called it.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I thought we were dead.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah, well, we're not.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: We got to get out of here.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: We have to go back.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: We're not going anywhere.  Not 'til we get what we came for.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: We just about got killed.  You know what happened?  We just about got killed, and you want to go on?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: So, you just let us drive on knowing we were losing fuel?  Knowing we were going to run low in the middle of nowhere?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: ...I figured...I figured you'd turn back.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: We're not stranded.  We've got enough gas in the other reserve to get us back.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Then lets go back while we still can.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: As soon as we hit the mountain we would have had to go on foot anyway.  We're not that far.  We can make it.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You two don't even know how crazy you are.  You want to go on your sick, little treasure hunt then go ahead, but mark me absent.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You have to go with us, Wes.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Really?  What is that, an order, <u>private</u>?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You have to go with us.  You can't walk back...

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Epps...

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Doesn't matter.  We're not going to be able to get him off it anyway.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: How long we going to keep this up.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Until we're out of the mine field is how long.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Haven't found a mine for half a mile, or more.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: That don't mean nothing.  Iraqis could have just spread them out like that; make us think we're in the clear.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You want to crawl, crawl.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: If all we wanted was the map out of you we could have taken it while you were standing on that mine pissing on yourself.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Probably would've too if Epps wasn't around to stop you.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I'm getting tired of you riding me, Jaeger.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Anytime you want to do something about it just let--

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Jesus!  What the hell did he do that for? They're Iraqis.  Why are Iraqis killing Iraqis?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Those people down there are Shi'ites. You've got Shi'ites in the south of Iraq and Khurds in the North.  Neither of them've got much love for Saddam. Probably figured once the war started there might be an uprising, so he sent his soldiers out to slap them around some.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Is there anything you do know?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I know you're a pussy.  I know that.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: We have to do something.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: We're American soldiers.  We don't abandon people.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Funny you should say that while we're out looking for gold.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You're the one wanted to kill Iraqis so bad.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I've got a new agenda now, it's get rich. The only way the Iraqis figure into that is not at all.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Think we can make it?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: We make it, or we go back empty handed.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Maybe they're as scared of us as we are of them.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Just seems weird they didn't chase us.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Lines up with the map and the photos.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: It's got a bottom.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Guess we know what the next stop is.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You down?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah, we're down.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What do you see?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What the hell are you doing!?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I think we found something.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: With what?  He doesn't have a weapon.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: He's a soldier.  He doesn't need a weapon.  He's got rocks.  He's got bare hands.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Says he's one of the soldiers that was in the helicopter.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: He lived through that?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Maybe we should give him some water.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: All last night he could have been--

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I think he wants something to drink.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I'm not wasting my water on him.
